absyn

Class Expression

  • java.lang.Object
    • absyn.Absyn
      • absyn.Expression
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinOp, Cast, Literal, Lvalue, MethodCallExpression, Minus, NewArray, NewObject, Not

    public abstract class Expression
extends Absyn
    A node of abstract syntax representing a Kitten expression. Expressions are syntactical structures which yield a value.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Type getStaticType()
      Returns the static semantical type of this expression, as computed during last type-checking.

      Yields the type-checker used during the last type-checking of this expression.
      java.lang.String toDot(java.io.FileWriter where)
      Writes in the specified file a dot representation of the abstract syntax of this expression.
      abstract Block translate(CodeSignature where, Block continuation)
      Translates this expression into its intermediate Kitten code.
      Block translateAs(CodeSignature where, Type type, Block continuation)
      Translates this expression by requiring that it leaves onto the stack a value of the given type.
      Block translateAsTest(CodeSignature where, Block yes, Block no)
      Translates this expression by assuming that it has boolean type.
      Type typeCheck(TypeChecker checker)
      Wrapper function that performs the type-checking of this expression by using a given type-checker.

      • Methods inherited from class absyn.Absyn

        getPos

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • getStaticType

        public final Type getStaticType()
        Returns the static semantical type of this expression, as computed during last type-checking.
        Returns:
        the static semantical type of this expression, if it has already been type-checked. Yields null otherwise

      • getTypeChecker

        public final TypeChecker getTypeChecker()
        Yields the type-checker used during the last type-checking of this expression.
        Returns:
        the type-checker used during the last type-checking of this expression. Yields null if this expression has not been type-checked yet

      • toDot

        public final java.lang.String toDot(java.io.FileWriter where)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Writes in the specified file a dot representation of the abstract syntax of this expression. By default, it writes a single dot node for this node of abstract syntax and it calls the auxiliary method toDotAux(FileWriter). Subclasses should redefine the latter in order to consider components of expressions.
        Parameters:
        where - the file where the dot representation must be written
        Returns:
        the name used to refer to this node in the dot file, as computed by Absyn.dotNodeName()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem while writing into the file

      • typeCheck

        public final Type typeCheck(TypeChecker checker)
        Wrapper function that performs the type-checking of this expression by using a given type-checker. It calls the expression-specific type-checking method typeCheckAux(TypeChecker) and then stores the static type of the expression into staticType. It records the type-checker inside checker.
        Parameters:
        checker - the type-checker to be used for type-checking
        Returns:
        the static type of the expression, as computed by the type-checker

      • translate

        public abstract Block translate(CodeSignature where,
                                Block continuation)
        Translates this expression into its intermediate Kitten code. The result is a piece of code which pushes onto the stack the value of the expression (the original stack elements are not modified) followed by a continuation
        Parameters:
        where - the method or constructor where this expression occurs
        continuation - the code executed after this expression
        Returns:
        the code which evaluates this expression and continues with continuation

      • translateAs

        public final Block translateAs(CodeSignature where,
                               Type type,
                               Block continuation)
        Translates this expression by requiring that it leaves onto the stack a value of the given type. The only difference with translate(CodeSignature, Block) is that it checks if the value left on top of the stack needs a type promotion.
        Parameters:
        where - the method or constructor where this expression occurs
        type - the type of the value which must be left onto the stack by the translation of this expression
        continuation - the continuation to be executed after this expression
        Returns:
        the code which evaluates this expression, followed by a possible type promotion to type, if needed

      • translateAsTest

        public Block translateAsTest(CodeSignature where,
                             Block yes,
                             Block no)
        Translates this expression by assuming that it has boolean type. This must have been guaranteed by a previous type-checking. Depending on the truth of that boolean value, control is routed to one of two possible destinations, through an if_true bytecode. Subclasses may redefine to get more improved code.
        Parameters:
        where - the method or constructor where this expression occurs
        yes - the continuation that is the yes destination
        no - the continuation that is the no destination
        Returns:
        the code that evaluates the expression and, on the basis of its boolean value, routes the computation to the yes or no continuation, respectively
